Startup compensation can be a maze! Variation across stages, disparate leveling structures, and a mix of cash, ESOPs, and PLI make designing a compelling rewards proposition without breaking the P&L quite complex. Last year, we stepped in to solve this by publishing benchmarks and insights on Cash and ESOPs for Product, Tech, and Design roles. This year, we've gone deeper! The expanded report now includes:

▷ Founder and leadership cash & equity compensation
▷ More job families such as Marketing, Finance, HR, Sales and more
▷ Data from 6,000+ employees (3x growth from last year), with a higher mix of growth and late-stage companies

In addition to the compensation data-backed research, we have also spoken to ~100 founders and CHROs across different stages and leveraged our experience of working on this subject with 75+ startups over the last 6 years.

Here are a few key insights:
▷ Founder equity varies widely (0.8% to 74%) with absolutely no correlation to valuation.
▷ MSOPs help mitigate dilution, with grants ranging from less than 1% to 6% of the company with different mechanics.
▷ Leadership pay increases by 20-30% at each stage of startup growth.
▷ Leaders in $5bn+ startups can make 4x their total cash earnings through ESOPs over their tenure (and up to 40x for highly critical leaders!).

Access the brief version of the report below for more such insights. We also have put together a comprehensive, full report that contains detailed pay ranges (25th to 90th percentile) on fixed and variable compensation for six job families—Marketing, Finance, Sales, Data Science, Engineering, and Design.

DM for the details on access to the full version or in case you are looking for a debrief of the report. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts in the comments section.
